discussion.content:
B and D are correct
SYSADMIN - Role that has privileges to create warehouses and databases (and other objects) in an account.
If, as recommended, you create a role hierarchy that ultimately assigns all custom roles to the SYSADMIN role, this role also has the ability to grant privileges on warehouses, databases, and other objects to other roles.

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/security-access-control-overview.html

Selected Answer: BD
B and D are correct

questions.question_text: What does Snowflake recommend regarding database object ownership? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Use only managed access schemas for objects owned by ACCOUNTADMIN.
choices.C: Create objects with SECURITYADMIN to ease granting of privileges later.
choices.D: Create objects with a custom role and grant this role to SYSADMIN.
choices.A: Create objects with ACCOUNTADMIN and do not reassign ownership.

questions.question_text: Other than ownership what privileges does a user need to view and modify resource monitors in Snowflake? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
BC is correct
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/security-access-control-privileges#resource-monitor-privileges

questions.question_text: What technique does Snowflake recommend for determining which virtual warehouse size to select?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/warehouses-considerations.html

choices.A: Always start with an X-Small and increase the size if the query does not complete in 2 minutes
choices.D: Use X-Large or above for tables larger than 1 GB
choices.C: Use the default size Snowflake chooses
choices.B: Experiment by running the same queries against warehouses of different sizes

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Step 1. Upload (i.e. stage) one or more data files to a Snowflake stage (named internal stage or table/user stage) using the PUT command. Step 2. Use the COPY INTO <table> command to load the contents of the staged file(s) into a Snowflake database table.

questions.question_text: Which command should be used when loading many flat files into a single table?
How can a Snowflake user share data with another user who does not have a Snowflake account?

choices.B: Create a reader account and create a share of the data
choices.C: Grant the READER privilege to the database that is going to be shared
choices.D: Move the Snowflake account to a region where data sharing is enabled
choices.A: Share the data by implementing User-Defined Functions (UDFs)
